thread.title: Randy couple give commuters an eyeful by 'going a bit too far' on busy train
thread.title_full: Randy couple give commuters an eyeful by 'going a bit too far' on busy train - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Randy couple give commuters an eyeful by 'going a bit too far' on busy train
text:
Randy couple give commuters an eyeful by 'going a bit too far' on busy train The steamy pair appeared to take the 'share a seat scheme' a bit too literally as they got hot and heavy on the morning commute   Share   Comments By Adam John 05:07, 9 FEB 2017 News The steamy sight was spotted on the Chatham to London Victoria train   Share   Comments Get daily   The morning commute to work isn't exactly the sexiest of situations - but it certainly got this randy couple in the mood.
The steamy pair gave commuters an eyeful as they got hot and heavy on a busy train, Kent Live reported . 
The lovers reportedly gave Lee Dalgleish an indignant look when he asked if the man would move his feet so he could sit down on the 8.45am service from Chatham to London Victoria . 
While the lady's long coat preserved a little of the couple's dignity, it was suggested underneath they may well have been participating in a saucy "share a seat scheme".
Lee, from Gillingham, said even though he can appreciate people wanting to be affectionate with their partners, grinding on an 8.45am train is going "a bit too far."
Read More Caught with their pants down: Mum shocked to find strangers having sex outside her window for the THIRD time The amorous couple didn't seem to care who saw them (Photo: Kent online) The 32-year-old said: "Lovely view on my way to work this morning. I have no issue with PDA (public displays of affection) as a rule but grinding your boyfriend to the point of penetration is going a bit far.
"They got off at Chatham...and they disembarked from the train."
Needless to say the post garnered a huge response on Facebook.
Read More BBC drama Apple Tree Yard features public sex scenes - but what would happen if you got caught? One user commented: "I think this is part of the 'share a seat scheme' the government are rolling out so they don't have to build HS2."
Another said: " Is it me or does her coat look the same as an old tv when it wasn't tuned in?"
Lee added: "Coincidentally I was listening to Lady Gaga at the time and "Edge of Glory" started playing. You don't get that on a commuter train... maybe on a Friday."
